#  iPhone Battery Replacement: Costs and Considerations 
   Troubleshooting information and battery replacement guides for iPhones. Restore your battery life or diagnose the shutdown problem that is plaguing your phone.  
  Author:  [Evan Gattuso](/User/4026158/Evan+Gattuso) [(and one other contributor)](/Wiki/History/iPhone_Battery_Replacement)                         **Fix the iPhone you already have** **– and save money and the planet in the process.**
 

- If your iPhone battery is dead, no worries, you can fix it with the information provided on this page.

- If you're unsure if your battery needs replacing, [start with troubleshooting](https://www.ifixit.com/Troubleshooting/iPhone).

- If you're on the fence about doing the repair yourself, or wondering if it's even worth it, [jump to the FAQ section and get more information](/Wiki/iPhone_Battery_Replacement#Section_Frequently_Asked_Questions) (and motivation).

 Find your iPhone model below and follow a step-by-step battery replacement guide. (Each guide will also link the corresponding fix kit with all the parts and tools needed to complete the guide.)
    [iPhone 11 Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+11+Battery+Replacement/127450)   [iPhone 11 Pro Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+11+Pro+Battery+Replacement/127686)   [iPhone 12 Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+12+Battery+Replacement/140588)   [iPhone 12 mini Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+12+mini+Battery+Replacement/139693)   [iPhone 12 Pro Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+15+Pro+Battery+Replacement/166394)   [iPhone 15 Pro Max Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+15+Pro+Max+Battery+Replacement/166239)   [iPhone 16 Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+16+Battery+Replacement/177286)   [iPhone 16 Plus Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+16+Plus+Battery+Replacement/177854)   [iPhone 7 Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+7+Battery+Replacement/67528)   [iPhone 7 Plus Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+7+Plus+Battery+Replacement/67612)   [iPhone 8 Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+8+Battery+Replacement/101279)   [iPhone 8 Plus Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+8+Plus+Battery+Replacement/98260)   [iPhone SE 2020 Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+SE+2020+Battery+Replacement/133814)   [iPhone SE 2022 Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+SE+2022+Battery+Replacement/150436)   [iPhone X Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+X+Battery+Replacement/103390)   [iPhone XR Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+XR+Battery+Replacement/116553)   [iPhone XS Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+XS+Battery+Replacement/117346)   [iPhone XS Max Battery Replacement](/Guide/iPhone+XS+Max+Battery+Replacement/117345)      Yes, you can replace your iPhone battery yourself. iFixit provides free [step-by-step repair guides](/Topic/iPhone) for every iPhone and sells DIY [Battery Fix Kits](https://www.ifixit.com/en-eu/Parts/iPhone/Batteries) for iPhones ranging from the 4 series to the 15 series. These kits include all the necessary tools and parts to replace your battery.

The repair process generally involves handling adhesive, screws, connectors, the screen, and is relatively straightforward. Apple simplified the battery replacement process by making the [iPhone 14's back glass removable](https://www.ifixit.com/News/64865/iphone-14-teardown) so a fixer does not need to remove the screen to access the battery. This “open from the front and back” design became the norm with the [iPhone 16 series](https://www.ifixit.com/News/100352/we-hot-wired-the-iphone-16) (the 16's battery is also secured by a new, more repair-friendly adhesive which debonds when an electrical current passes through it).
  Using an iFixit kit to replace your iPhone battery yourself can save you $34 to $49 compared to Apple's out-of-warranty repair costs, depending on your model. iFixit's battery replacement kits average around $40, while kits for newer models like the iPhone 15 cost around $60.

2024.*
  While the time investment can vary based on the iPhone model and your DIY experience, repairing your iPhone battery yourself is feasible. The repair should take you anywhere from 30 minutes to a couple of hours. If you get stuck, iFixit's [community of fixers](https://www.ifixit.com/Answers/Device/iPhone) can help.
